sourcesContent:
<template>
  <section class="app-main">
    <slot :connected="connected"
          :dataObject="dataObject"
    />
  </section>
</template>

<script>

import {computed, inject, onActivated, onDeactivated, onMounted, onUnmounted, provide, ref, watch} from "vue";
import mqttUtils from "@/composables/mqttUtils.mjs";
import configUtils from "@/composables/configUtils.mjs";

export default {
  props: ['subscribedTopics', 'mqttCallback'],
  emits: ['dataObject'],

  setup: function (props, { emit }) {
    let connected = ref(false); //Boolean value that indicates if the client is connected to the broker
    let dataObject = ref({})  //Object containing all our actual data, gets updated depending on subscribed topics
    let subscribedTopics = ref([]); //Array containing the subscribed topics for this component

    /**
     * Watch changes to the data and update them for the parent component
     */
    watch(dataObject, ()=>{
      emit("dataObject", dataObject)
    })

    let isActive = ref(false);  //indicate if the Home component is isActive

    //Use the configuration fetched from the api to build the dataObject
    inject('apiClient').getConfig("CAN_out_config").then((outConfig)=> {
      let configUtil = new configUtils(outConfig)
      dataObject.value = configUtil.getDataObject()
    })

    //Use the mqtt client to create an mqttUtil instance, and update our data automatically with a callback
    const MqttCallback = (topic, message) => {
      mqttUtils.updateDataFromJSON(message, dataObject)
    }
    let mqttUtil = new mqttUtils(inject('mqttClient'), MqttCallback)

    watch(subscribedTopics, ()=>{
      //this is not working for some reason
      if (isActive.value) {
        console.log("subscribed to " + subscribedTopics)
        mqttUtil.subscribeTo(props.subscribedTopics)
      }
    })

    /**
     * Subscribe to the required topics if not already done
     * @param requiredValues array of required values containing path Strings
     */
    const subscribeRequiredTopics = (requiredValues) => {
      let fieldPathArray = []
      Object.entries(requiredValues).forEach(([, fieldPath])=>{
        fieldPathArray = fieldPath.split("/")
        subscribedTopics.value.push(`${fieldPathArray[0]}/${fieldPathArray[1]}`)
      })
    }

    /**
     * Update the data of a module based on their required values
     * @param requiredValues array of required values containing path Strings
     * @param childData The data object of the module. follows the same convention
     */
    const updateChildData = (requiredValues, childData) => {
      let fieldPathArray = []

      Object.entries(requiredValues).forEach(([fieldName, fieldPath]) => {
        fieldPathArray = fieldPath.split("/")
        childData.value[fieldName] = dataObject.value[fieldPathArray[0]][fieldPathArray[1]][fieldPathArray[2]]
      })
    }

    const canUpdateChildData = computed(()=>{
      return (dataObject.value && isActive.value)
    })

    onActivated(()=> {
      isActive.value = true
      console.log(props.subscribedTopics.value)
      mqttUtil.subscribeTo(props.subscribedTopics)
    })

    onDeactivated(()=> {
      isActive.value = false
      mqttUtil.resetClient()
    })

    /**
     * Add listeners to update the connected status
     */
    function addConnectedListeners(){
      console.log("update vars")
      //Update connected status correctly
      if(mqttUtil.connected()) connected.value = true
      mqttUtil.on('connect', () => connected.value = true)
      mqttUtil.on('disconnect', () => connected.value = false)
      mqttUtil.on('reconnect', () => connected.value = false)
    }
    addConnectedListeners()


    return {dataObject, connected, subscribeRequiredTopics, updateChildData, canUpdateChildData}
  }
}

</script>

<style scoped>

</style>
